column4: can someone tell me then why sudo cp fonts /usr/share/fonts didn't work? is it because the folders where the sam ename maybe?
is "sudo cp fonts /usr/share/fonts" exactly what you typed
yea
where are you copying from? Where is the source dir?
home?
the fonts folder was in /home/username
i wanted to copy it to /usr/share/fonts
try typing this: sudo cp ~/home/fonts /usr/share/fonts
ah...is that better command line?
i dont think so, but it might help
thing is i've done it now via gui. But i wanted to do it the cool and geeky way
will do. Its just that in the past for other things the way i originally tried i thought was the way. At least i think it has worked before
but i'll bear that in mind as an option
the first command you typed should of worked, you have a directory named "fonts" inside your home folder, and you want to copy the contents to /usr/share/fonts?
thats right. Does having two folders with the same name create an issue?
try going into "your" fonts directory and typing this: sudo cp * /usr/share/fonts               that should copy everything inside your fonts directory to /usr/share/fonts
magic! that is a coold trick - thanks
did it work?
yea!
thats one mean asterisk
the asterisk means everything, you can also use it like this: cp vacation*           for everything that starts with vacation
thanks for the tip - i learnt something to day  '<
anytime
